alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 09 at 9:11PM MST until March 11 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON THURSDAY TO 5 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 10 inches with locally higher amounts up to 14 inches on higher peaks. * WHERE...East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains, and Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass. * WHEN...From Noon Thursday to 5 AM MST Friday. The heaviest snow will fall Thursday afternoon and night. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Low temperatures in the single digits and teens Thursday night with wind chill readings as cold as 10 degrees below zero.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass
